Package Game

Class SimpleGameBoard

java.lang.Object
Game.SimpleGameBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class SimpleGameBoard extends Object implements Serializable
An instantiable, simplified version of the GameBoard class which is used for save/load states, since IOStream seems to have an issue with the regular GameBoard, presumably due to the 2D array of GameTile, which extends JLabel. Instead of the game's state being stored as a 2D GameTile array, it will be stored as a 2D Integer array and be converted when needed.
Author:
Daniel Arefjev
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleGameBoard

      public SimpleGameBoard()
      Default no-argument constructor for a SimpleGameBoard object. Doesn't do anything.

    • SimpleGameBoard

      public SimpleGameBoard(int boardSize, int[][] gameState)
      2 argument constructor for a SimpleGameBoard object. Passes 2 arguments to setBoardSize() and setGameState().
      Parameters:
      boardSize - the size (width/height) of the game board.
      gameState - the game state of the game board. Stored as a 2D integer array as opposed to a 2D GameTile array.

  • Method Details

    • getGameState

      public int[][] getGameState()
      Method to get the game state of a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      Returns gameState, a 2D integer array containing the state of the game (more specifically the state of a tile at a specific index)

    • setGameState

      public void setGameState(int[][] gameState)
      Method to set the game state of a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      gameState - the game state to set for a SimpleGameBoard object.

    • setBoardSize

      public void setBoardSize(int boardSize)
      Method to set the board size of a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      boardSize - the board size to set for a SimpleGameBoard object.

    • getBoardSize

      public int getBoardSize()
      Method to get the board size of a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      boardSize, an Integer value corresponding to the width/height of a game board. (e.g boardSize = 7 means it's a 7x7 board.)

    • setAIStuff

      public void setAIStuff(boolean aiToggle, int aiDifficulty)
      Method to set AI related parameters of a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      aiToggle - a boolean value, where false means the AI is toggled off, true is on.
      aiDifficulty - an integer value corrosponding to the difficulty of the AI, where 0 is the easiest and higher values get harder. (Currently at a max of 2)

    • setLastAIMove

      public void setLastAIMove(int lastAIMove)
      Method to set the last AI move made in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      lastAIMove - the column last selected by the AI.

    • getLastAIMove

      public int getLastAIMove()
      Method to get the last AI move made in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      an integer value corresponding to the column the AI last selected.

    • getAIToggle

      public boolean getAIToggle()
      Method to get the aiToggle of a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      a boolean value, where false means the AI is toggled off, and true means the AI is toggled on.

    • getAiDifficulty

      public int getAiDifficulty()
      Method to get the AI difficulty of a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      an integer value corresponding to the difficulty of the AI, where 0 is the easiest and higher values get harder. (Currently at a max of 2)

    • getPlayer

      public int getPlayer()
      Method to get the current player in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      an integer value, either 1 or 2.

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer(int player)
      Method to set the current player in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to set as currently active in a SimpleGameBoard object.

    • setPlayerIcons

      public void setPlayerIcons(int player1Icon, int player2Icon)
      Method to set both player's icons in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      player1Icon - the icon index to set for player 1.
      player2Icon - the icon index to set for player 2.

    • getPlayer1Icon

      public int getPlayer1Icon()
      Methods to get each player's icon in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      an integer value which corresponds to the index of an ImageIcon array in the Connect4Game class.

    • getPlayer2Icon

      public int getPlayer2Icon()

    • setWinner

      public void setWinner(int winner)
      Method to set the winner of a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      winner - the player that won the game.

    • getWinner

      public int getWinner()
      Method to get the winner of a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      an integer value corresponding to which player won the game - if there's no winners it returns 0.

    • setPlayerNames

      public void setPlayerNames(String player1Name, String player2Name)
      Method to set both players names in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      player1Name - the name of player 1.
      player2Name - the name of player 2.

    • getPlayer1Name

      public String getPlayer1Name()
      Methods to get the names of the players in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      a String containing either Player 1 or Player 2's name, depending on which method is called.

    • getPlayer2Name

      public String getPlayer2Name()

    • setTimeStarted

      public void setTimeStarted(GregorianCalendar timeStarted)
      Method to set the time at which a game was started in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      timeStarted - the time at which a game was started, as a GregorianCalendar object.

    • getTimeStarted

      public GregorianCalendar getTimeStarted()
      Method to get the time at which a game was started in a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      a GregorianCalendar object containing the system time at which a game was created.

    • setTimeElapsed

      public void setTimeElapsed(GregorianCalendar timeElapsed)
      Method to set the time elapsed within a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      timeElapsed - a GregorianCalendar object containing the minutes/seconds a game elapsed.

    • getTimeElapsed

      public GregorianCalendar getTimeElapsed()
      Method to get the time elapsed within a SimpleGameBoard object.
      Returns:
      a GregorianCalendar object containing how long a game elapsed.
